The Service will accept an offer in compromise when it is unlikely that the tax liability can be collected in full and the amount offered reasonably reﬂects potential. An offer in compromise is a legitimate alternative to declaring a case currently not collectible or to a protracted installment agreement. The goal is to achieve collection of what is potentially collectible at the earliest possible time and at the least cost to the Government.
